serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
World WorldSat Color Shaded Relief, 2008 is a raster theme representing a cloud-free view of the Earth produced by mosaicking hundreds of individual 1996 NOAA weather satellite images. These satellites orbit the Earth at an altitude of 800 km (497 miles). The image has a cell size of four square kilometers (1.544 sq. mi.) at the equator.
On completion of the base satellite mosaic, the land areas were enhanced with shaded relief imagery, derived from 1,000-meter digital elevation data, bringing the Earth's topography to life. For the Ocean areas, WorldSat incorporated ocean floor relief data (bathymetry), providing a view of the undersea topography.
descript.purpose: World WorldSat Color Shaded Relief provides a shaded relief background on which other data can be displayed.
descript.supplinf:
This dataset is available via the ArcSDE from the EDS lab via this .lyr file:
https://www1.columbia.edu/sec/acis/eds/dgate/studies/C1301/data/WorldSatColorShadedRelief.zip

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

citeinfo.title: World WorldSat Color Shaded Relief Image

procstep.procdesc:
This data represents a cloud-free view of the Earth produced by mosaicking hundreds of individual 1996 NOAA weather satellite images. These satellites orbit the Earth at an altitude of 800 km (497 miles). The image has a cell size of four square kilometers (1.544 sq. mi.) at the equator.
On completion of the base satellite mosaic, the land areas were enhanced with shaded relief imagery, derived from 1,000-meter digital elevation data, bringing the Earth's topography to life. For the Ocean areas, WorldSat incorporated ocean floor relief data (bathymetry), providing a view of the undersea topography.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted data set from WorldSat International, Inc. media. Converted to MrSID image format. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr).

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates
